devdoc.author: CXIP-Labs
devdoc.details: This smart contract is not intended to be used directly. Apply it to any of your ERC721 or ERC1155 smart contracts through a delegatecall fallback.

SecondarySaleFees(uint256,address[],uint.details: Emits event in order to comply with Rarible V1 royalty spec.

params.bps: Uint256 array of base points(percentages) that each wallet(specified in recipients) will receive from the royalty payouts. Make sure that all the base points add up to a total of 10000.
params.recipients: Address array of wallets that will receive tha royalties.
params.tokenId: Specific token id for which royalty info is being set, set as 0 for all tokens inside of the smart contract.

configurePayouts(address[],uint256[]).details: Function can only we called by owner, admin, or identity wallet.Addresses and bps arrays must be equal length. Bps values added together must equal 10000 exactly.

params.addresses: An array of all the addresses that will be receiving royalty payouts.
params.bps: An array of the percentages that each address will receive from the royalty payouts.

constructor.details: Since the smart contract is being used inside of a fallback context, the constructor function is not being used.

getEthPayout().details: Distribute all the ETH(minus gas fees) to payout recipients.

getPayoutInfo().details: These are the recipients that will be getting royalty payouts.

returns.addresses: An array of all the addresses that will be receiving royalty payouts.
returns.bps: An array of the percentages that each address will receive from the royalty payouts.

getStorageSlot(string).details: Convert a string to a bytes32 storage slot

params.slot: The string name of storage slot(without the 'eip1967.PA1D.' prefix)

returns._0: A bytes32 reference to the storage slot

getTokenAddress(string).details: Used only to identify really major/common tokens. Avoid using due to gas usages.

params.tokenName: The ticker symbol of the token. For example "USDC" or "DAI".

returns._0: The smart contract address of the token ticker symbol. Or zero address if not found.

getTokenPayout(address).details: Contract owner, admin, identity wallet, and payout recipients can call this function.

params.tokenAddress: An address of the token for which to issue payouts for.

getTokenPayoutByName(string).details: Contract owner, admin, identity wallet, and payout recipients can call this function.Avoid using this function at all costs, due to high gas usage, and no guarantee for token support.

params.tokenName: A string of the token name for which to issue payouts for.

getTokensPayout(address[]).details: Each token balance must be equal or greater than 10000. Otherwise calculating BP is difficult.

params.tokenAddresses: An address array of tokens to issue payouts for.

getTokensPayoutByName(string[]).details: Each token balance must be equal or greater than 10000. Otherwise calculating BP is difficult.Avoid using this function at all costs, due to high gas usage, and no guarantee for token support.

params.tokenNames: A string array of token names to issue payouts for.

init(uint256,address,uint256).details: Use the init function once, when deploying or initialising your overlying smart contract.Take great care to not expose this function to your other public functions.

params.bp: The default base points(percentage) for royalty payouts.
params.receiver: The address for the default receiver of all royalty payouts. Recommended to use the overlying smart contract address. This will allow the PA1D smart contract to handle all royalty settings, receipt, and distribution.
params.tokenId: Specify a particular token id only if using the init function for a special case. Otherwise leave empty(0).

setRoyalties(uint256,address,uint256).details: Take great care to not make this function accessible by other public functions in your overlying smart contract.

params.bp: Uint256 of royalty percentage, provided in base points format.
params.receiver: Wallet or smart contract that will receive the royalty payouts.
params.tokenId: Set a specific token id, or leave at 0 to set as default parameters.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Provides the supported interface ids that this contract implements.

params.interfaceId: Bytes4 of the interface, derived through bytes4(keccak256('sampleFunction(uin256,address)')).

returns._0: True if function is supported/implemented, false if not.

devdoc.title: PA1D (CXIP)

SecondarySaleFees(uint256,address[],uint.notice: Event emitted when setting/updating royalty info/fees. This is used by Rarible V1.

configurePayouts(address[],uint256[]).notice: Set the wallets and percentages for royalty payouts.

constructor.notice: Constructor is empty and not utilised.

getEthPayout().notice: Get payout of all ETH in smart contract.

getPayoutInfo().notice: Show the wallets and percentages of payout recipients.

getStorageSlot(string).notice: Get the storage slot for given string

getTokenAddress(string).notice: Get the smart contract address of a token by common name.

getTokenPayout(address).notice: Get payout for a specific token address. Token must have a positive balance!

getTokenPayoutByName(string).notice: Get payout for a specific token name. Token must have a positive balance!

getTokensPayout(address[]).notice: Get payouts for tokens listed by address. Tokens must have a positive balance!

getTokensPayoutByName(string[]).notice: Get payouts for tokens listed by name. Tokens must have a positive balance!

init(uint256,address,uint256).notice: Initialise the smart contract on source smart contract deployment/initialisation.

setRoyalties(uint256,address,uint256).notice: Set the royalty information for entire contract, or a specific token.

userdoc.notice: A smart contract for providing royalty info, collecting royalties, and distributing it to configured payout wallets.
